entities.name: potter
entities.description: The person being addressed by Professor Snape. The text describes Potter as someone who has been affected by the curse and is sharing thoughts with the Dark Lord.

entities.name: dark lord
entities.description: A powerful and evil entity that has a connection to Potter. The text suggests that the Dark Lord's thoughts and emotions are being shared with Potter when he is asleep.

entities.name: professor dumbledore
entities.description: The headmaster of Hogwarts who thinks it inadvisable for Potter to continue sharing thoughts with the Dark Lord. The text describes Dumbledore as someone who wants to teach Potter how to close his mind to the Dark Lord.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: A professor at Hogwarts who is tasked with teaching Potter how to close his mind to the Dark Lord. The text describes Snape as someone who is staring at Harry and tracing his mouth.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story who is being addressed by Professor Snape. The text describes Harry as someone who has been affected by the curse and is sharing thoughts with the Dark Lord.

entities.name: mr. weasley
entities.description: A person who was attacked by a snake. The text suggests that Potter's ability to see the attack allowed Dumbledore to save Weasley.

entities.name: snake
entities.description: An animal that attacked Mr. Weasley. The text describes the snake as something that Potter was able to see and prevent from harming Weasley.

entities.name: harry's heart
entities.description: A part of Harry's body that is described as pumping fast again.

relationships.description: The text suggests that Potter and the Dark Lord share thoughts and emotions when Potter is asleep.
Dumbledore is concerned for Potter's well-being and wants to teach him how to close his mind to the Dark Lord.
Snape has been tasked with teaching Potter how to close his mind to the Dark Lord.
